content.name: Empathy
content.description: Practiced at seeing from others perspectives, but I'm not very socially perceptive.

content.name: Rapport building
content.description: I build friendly relationships with coworkers, be amiable and can reach across conflict, but I'm slow to catch myself when I'm blundering.

content.name: Written communication
content.description: Experienced with scientific and management report writing through my tertiary education, but I lack the skills that come with decades of experience. I have a tendency to read thoroughly that might inhibit speed reading.

content.name: Verbal communication
content.description: While I deliberately practice active listening and have been called articulate, my ability to distill complex information was limited during my research internship at AgResearch. I struggle to comprehend multiple people talking at once, but can navigate chaotic environments. I get the jitters when doing public speaking.

content.name: Feedback
content.description: I practice reframing everything as opportunities for growth and use common techniques for eliciting feedback from others. But I can sometimes overestimate willingness for blunt conversation when giving feedback instead of eliciting self-reflection and highlighting strengths

content.name: Professionalism
content.description: I can keep friendly when others are hostile, but I'm not used to the presentational standards of customer facing work. I think I could quickly grow used to careful choice of words and presentation rather than being intrinsically unconcerned about my presentation.

content.name: Initiative and responsiveness
content.description: I can generally find and address gaps in needs, but once I've set my mind on something it can be hard for me to switch my attention without considerable effort

content.name: Time management
content.description: I can generally prioritise competing demands and be punctual. Even while volunteering, starting a business with friends, and studying full time, I've only ever had to use an extension on an assignment once. But I'm yet to test the limits of my time management abilities so I can't give a precise assessment of my skill here.

content.name: Work ethic
content.description: While I struggled with this in the past I now consistently put hours into my occupation every week-day, as might be supported by my academic record. Disruptions to my ability to work are controlled by medication. But I'm yet to pressure test my work ethic outside of redoing entire coding projects close to deadlines (I didn't test how long I could work in intense bursts fo cognitive work totalling over eight hours a day until I broke, so I don't know where that line is at the moment). I have moderate self-motivation abilities.

content.name: Integrity
content.description: I sometimes fail at tight lipped confidentially by assuming people already know things. And well I think I have a good sense of responsibility, harm and growth, I'm not immune to the temptations of white lies.

content.name: Critical thinking
content.description: I was trained in critical thinking at the postgraduate level and find ways to exercise this skill for fun in my own time.

content.name: Systems thinking
content.description: I practice systems thinking but I am a beginner, having only completed a basic course and practiced formally since them. But I've been thinking about things as feedback systems for well over a decade.

content.name: Linear thinking
content.description: I've experience orchestrating chains of reasoning and causality from programming and studies in biology. Well I've been able to improvise solutions to unexpected complications under time pressure, my strengths lie in deeper, slower considerations. However, my working memory has gotten worse since starting medication, reducing this ability somewhat.

content.name: Lateral thinking
content.description: I enjoy approaching problems from uinexpected angles. But while I can throw bunches of ideas at the wall to see what sticks, maintaining creativity when creating solutions based on systematic inferences from unique perspectives is something I need more practice in.

content.name: Creative problem solving
content.description: This is one of my favourite skills to engage with and grow. I use it in my hobbies, assignments, projects, and hypothetical situations just to have a bit of fun. The greatest weakness I'm aware off in this area occurs during the prolonged execution of iterative solutions to problems where information is complete, and I can't find alternative perspectives to keep the novelty of the problem going, leading to reduced motivation.

content.name: Android development with Java
content.description: I achieved an A in my mobile development course, in which I developed apps including one that generates colours that are complimentary to the user's colour pallete (taken from skin, hair, eyes)

content.name: Parallel programming with C++
content.description: A+ in parallel computing course where I parallelised a 'N-body problem' particle simulator with the Threads and OpenMP libraries. Most Massey courses were taught in C++.

content.name: Web development
content.description: I've used HTML, CSS, JS, and some of SQL for almost a decade and have coded backends in ASP.NET, PHP, Flask and Django. I've taken courses in web development and cloud computation which familiarised me with AWS. I've had the privilege of developing web applications such as a e-commerce site for a florist, and course selection and bus timetable management applications for my old highschool. I built my electronic-CV with HTML5. However, I'm rusty and don't have a working knowledge of modern development frameworks (e.g. Svelt, React.js), nor have I taken any formal database development and management or socket programming courses.

content.name: Network design and configuration
content.description: In a networks and security course I learnt to design and set up computer networks using CISCO routers via simulators. But it's been a while since that course and I have no real world experience.

content.name: Prompt engineering with Python
content.description: I'm working towards working proficiency in intelligent systems including machine learning, to build on the AI course I took in my GradDipInfSci. With a recent project creating a tailored news podcast from RSS and newsfeeds using web scraping, LLMs and prompt engineering, and TTS via python, Hugging Face serverless inference, and Google's whisper. Currently hosted as a Flask web app.

content.name: Attention to detail
content.description: Hundreds of hours of wet laboratory work during my BSc training taught me to work precisely and accurately for hours under pressure (small deviations in operations could lead to inaccurate results). However, I'm yet to test this ability in a professional environment.

content.name: Physical fitness
content.description: I’ve worked on my fitness through near-daily runs and calisthenics workouts along with multiple walks a day. My estimated VO2 max is 52, but I haven't re-achieved a desirable body composition.

content.name: Food hygiene
content.description: I’ve kept up food hygiene practices I learnt during hospitality courses at highschool.
